My grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my father said to him "if you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up his eyes when he realised what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My father said to me- "Don't ever smoke. Please don't ever put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 23, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

I really like the competitive aspect of CSGO. It makes you have to work as a team and communicate the best to your abilities. Sometimes you don't always get the best teammates which is why you gotta find people to play with so you know you'll have a good game. All around a very good game and you just gotta have fun with it and enjoy the experience and you'll have a blast.

CSGO used to be such a good game in it's prime but over the past couple years they have slowly been ruining competitive. You can't play a single game at the lowest rank without being against gods with 1-2k hours. 0/10 impossible to get into if you're new due to competitive difficulty.
